website_summaries.verdict: A great choice for compartmentalized glass meal prep containers that are versatile and durable.
pros: These stand out for being versatile enough to use in the freezer, microwave, and oven, with the added advantage of having 3 separate compartments
Owners praise the sturdiness and high quality
The compartments help with portion control and keep foods separate
cons: A few had issues with the lids being difficult to line up correctly or not sealing completely

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Meal Prepping!
customer_reviews.text: I love these containers! Perfect for meal prepping! I like how the tops have vents! I've been using these for a few months now and no complaints! Probably going to order some more. They're good quality!
customer_reviews.author: Some-Lady-Who-Reviews

customer_reviews.title: The seal ring is removable for easy cleaning. The nice pop-top vent allows food to ...
customer_reviews.text: These are spectacular!!! They are airtight so the week's food I do for lunches and such stay fresh for the whole week. They are strong and very durable. The four part latching system insures your food is completely sealed. The seal ring is removable for easy cleaning. The nice pop-top vent allows food to cool if packed in hot . Once cool, close pop-top and stick in the fridge. Husband is rough on things including his lunch box and so far these are holding up so nice!! Many others I have tried have been broken in a matter of days. I love these !!!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Fragile??
customer_reviews.text: I originally thought that these were great for my breakfast that I prepare in advance and reheat in the microwave on a low setting. However, this morning I was just holding one, after having just taken it out of the frig, and it broke in half. Half of the glass container just fell on to the countertop. I hadn't hit it against anything, heated it, or done anything to stress it. It just broke. I know seriously doubt the quality and veracity of the claims of the manufacturer. BUYER BEWARE!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Opened up the package to find the second container has had the rubber seal stuck on to the glass and broke when removing the lid. Lids seem to be cheap plastic. Haven't decided how I feel about these. *Update* So two more have broken, the seal in the lid has a tendency to stick to the glass. First time using them and they fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe, glass chips
customer_reviews.text: This product started off great but has been a disappointment. I have had this product for less than two months and used each roughly 5 times. Two of my containers have chipped at the short side on the rim and have sharp glass exposed. Both chipped when simply closing the snap lids onto the containers. The two containers are now not usable due to the sharp glass. So far my other three are still in great condition but now that I don’t have a working set I can’t due a full meal prep on Sunday’s.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy this brand!
customer_reviews.text: I started loving the glass dishes with the air tight snap on lids. I never had a problem until I purchased these. You literally have to smack the closures with your hand hard to close. They are all like this! Never will buy this brand again!
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Safe and easy containers
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I got these glass with lid containers. (I had similar containers that were BPA free plastic; but as I now know they still have potential dangers.) I have put soup in them and turned them on their sides for transportation & not a single leak. They are roomy enough I can stuff them with leftovers but still heats the food evenly. I was worried about the white rubberband turning ugly colors but so far nothing... Also, I recieved an email from the company encouraging me to leave feedback; within the email was a nice little ebook.
customer_reviews.author: Mummy

customer_reviews.title: Way better than plastic
customer_reviews.text: The glass containers hold up very well to the microwave and dishwasher. I love the pop on lids, they seal much better than the snap in type with a seal.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Nice size for lunches or leftovers
customer_reviews.text: We have been making the switch from those flimsy plastic containers to glass for a while. I had purchased some from Pampered Chef and was wanting to try a more frugal alternative. I've found it with this 10 piece set (5 glass containers with 5 plastic locking lids). They are able to nest inside each other a bit, to make stacking them in the cupboard easier. Excited that these are just in time for the holidays to send leftovers home with family. Another bonus is there are 5 - so if you do once a week food prep, you have enough containers to take for your 5 workweek lunches. Great product, would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: superjaxster

customer_reviews.title: Great but annoying to clean
customer_reviews.text: The glass containers are great, but the lids are not dishwasher safe and that is why the 3-stars. Also, the white rubber lining in the lids separates from the lids every time you take off the lid. They either stick to the glass or just separate enough from the lid that you have to pull it all the way off to put it back on the lid. Either way, the rubber seal has to be cleaned separately from the lid and that is annoying. I want all-dishwasher safe cleaning. I don't want to hand wash every time nor try to figure out white white rubber seal goes with which container (I have similar containers of multiple sizes).
customer_reviews.author: ToSassy

customer_reviews.title: Best Food Storage Containers Ever!!
customer_reviews.text: I love these glass food containers. I much prefer glass over plastic. No chance of melting the container. You can put them in the freezer, microware or oven. The tops snap down tightly so there's no chance of leaking. I take my food to work in these containers in my back pack and never worry about leaking. I would definitely recommend these containers to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Joe S

customer_reviews.title: Crappy Lids
customer_reviews.text: The lids do NOT fit properly, the tabs keep popping open, and it is on all 5 containers, not just a random one. Even though the dish is a great size, I would not recommend these containers, at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with Purhase
customer_reviews.text: I’m in love with these! An awesome set. I will be looking to buy more in the future. I caught these when they were the deal of the day! Keep a look out cause they are worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Containers,  I Would Buy Again
customer_reviews.text: These are great containers, slowly but surely I am replacing all my 'garbage plastic' containers with glass. It's such a pleasure to cook something, take it off the stove and place it into glass. I just don't trust plastic. These are a great size, there are 5 of them and the lids are sturdy and not flimsy. A true quality product. I recall years ago when mom only used glass and not this harmful plastic garbage. A terrific buy, I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Artsygal

customer_reviews.title: Opened the box and the plastic on the lid that ...
customer_reviews.text: Opened the box and the plastic on the lid that causes the seal was stuck to the glass and actually broke on one of the lids.
customer_reviews.author: david v strain

customer_reviews.title: Great Product! Great Service!
customer_reviews.text: We've recently switched all of our plastic tupperware out for glass and these are great! I was looking for a large enough container to fit one dish meals like pot roast in versus all of the smaller subdivided containers. They seem very durable and have proved to be leak proof. When I received my first order I found that the seal on one of the lids was broken and emailed Prep Naturals to see about a replacement. They immediately sent me out a replacement free of charge. Great customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Acker

customer_reviews.title: These have replaced my tupperware
customer_reviews.text: These glass containers are replacing the plastic containers in my home. I held onto the plastic "just in case", but after months of only using the glass I have thrown away all of my plastic containers. These are great for storing food, reheating in the microwave or oven, and sometimes I even eat my meal right out of this dish! Such a great choice!!
customer_reviews.author: Just Me and My Coffee

customer_reviews.title: Don't get swindled!
customer_reviews.text: The reviews are fake... I tried to save some money on glass containers and these seem like the best deal. The problem is that the lids either don't close without excessive force, or the snaps don't stay snapped. The cover for the hole on top does not snap into place and is very loose, so don't think about storing soup for lunch in these. Searched high and low for containers with a similar price, shape, size, and set of features. I ended up replacing these cheap soda-lime glass containers with more expensive cheap soda-lime glass Pyrex brand (Pyrex Ultimate 3-cup) containers. They sure don't make them like they used to.
customer_reviews.author: A. Kwong

customer_reviews.title: Great containers!
customer_reviews.text: These have been great for meal prepping and storage! The durable glass makes it easy to heat up in the microwave and the lid secures tightly so there isn’t any leaks. I also really like that the rubber seal can come out to be washed to prevent any buildup. And all parts have gone through the dishwasher several times and have held up! Only bad thing is they don’t stack inside each other so I store them with their lids on in the cabinet. But then again I use them so often they don’t stay stored away for long!
customer_reviews.author: Stacey M

customer_reviews.title: Does what I need it to do
customer_reviews.text: These are bigger than I expected but that's what I wanted: versatility. I can use it store leftovers and I can use it for lunch meals. I also want to give the seller a HUGE praise. One of my lids came slightly cracked and when I reached out for an exchange, they told me not to worry - an entirely new container was on its way and I can feel free to donate the damaged container (no need to return). LOVE great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Camila

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for eco-friendly meal prep
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to use less plastic and more glass in my meal storage which is why I ended up buying this set. The glass is thick and really durable, the lids fit snugly and everything is dishwasher safe. I feel better knowing I don't have chemicals leaching into my food. Well made product.
customer_reviews.author: HoorayForCoffee

customer_reviews.title: Glass chipped in a week
customer_reviews.text: I thought these glasses were amazing at first. A great size and easy to clean. (Though the tops were difficult to snap on). While eating my lunch today I chomped on a big chard of glass that had chipped from the container. The glass cut my mouth and stabbed thumb causing both to bleed. The product was not dropped or anything. Very disappointed. Also had to throw my lunch away due to small glass chips in the meal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable!
customer_reviews.text: These were a bit too big for what I needed but the quality seemed great! They seem strong..durable.
customer_reviews.author: Tasha

customer_reviews.title: What's with the lids?
customer_reviews.text: Out of the 5 containers, none of the lids would fully snap on. Two would snap on two sides, two on one side and one wouldn't snap on any side. My husband couldn't get them on either. This particular set was a complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: Great for holding leftovers!
customer_reviews.text: I have always used plastic containers in the past and have had to buy replacements often because of discoloring and warping of the plastic . Being glass these do not hold orders, warp, and discolor. The lids are plastic but I have had no problems with them at all. They are easy to latch and seal shut. My only issue is after washing them in my dishwasher one chipped and another broke even though they are not thin at all.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Sage

customer_reviews.title: Temperatures change the way the lids fit
customer_reviews.text: The lids don’t always snap shut and at times won’t close at all. This is an issue when meal prepping as you put them in the fridge then the lid don’t snap into place and securely to keep food inside causing a mess in the lunch box. I need to know my food isn’t going to spill out!
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine17268

customer_reviews.title: Love/Hate Relationship
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of these. I love the glass base. I HATE the lid. It is extremely difficult to get all four sides clicked on and I have literally sent the entire unit crashing as I try to secure it. The glass base is very well made and easy to clean. The lid is not dishwasher safe, which isn't a deal breaker, but it's not easy to clean all the crevices and with the difficulty of the lid installation, it's the last thing I grab out of the cupboard to use. I really wanted to love these. If they improved the lid system, I would definitely try them again.
customer_reviews.author: Windinmyhair

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these in an effort to reduce and eliminate the plastic ziplock baggies we always used for freezing. After a few months of using these, I realize they are NOT airtight (as promised) and when I freeze chicken breasts in them, they are freezer burned very quickly!! I’m Very disappointed!! 😳
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: These looked nice and had solid reviews but opened two out of the box and the lid gasket fell out and ripped. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy these. Lids don’t clasp shut.
customer_reviews.text: I never imagined I’d be leaving a negative review about a food storage container but these are terrible. They arrived Undamaged and on time but the lids do not lock. The lid must be too small for the container because I can get 3 sides of them to clasp and then nothing works to get the last one closed. I brought one to work hoping nothing would leak and had my coworkers try closing these as well and no one could do it. It’s the exact size I was looking for and they seem sturdy but what use is that if you can’t close the lids on them??
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: The lids are extremely difficult to close and the product is absolutely not airtight as described. I wrestled it closed and it leaked fruit juice all over my bag, ruining several items. I had put cut fruit salad in the container with minimal liquid and it definitely didn’t work as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Glass is better than plastic!
customer_reviews.text: I am trying to switch from plastic to glass for my food storage, which is why I got these. I feel like my food is fresher, and being in glass makes it easier and safer to reheat if I'm using the microwave. Others have said that the lids are a little tight, but I find that comforting - I don't want air in there! Easy to clean, and dishwasher safe. I've been using them every day since I got them, both for meal prep and for leftovers.
customer_reviews.author: J.A.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: The containers themselves aren’t bad, except for the fact that two of the containers had one of the locking tabs break off. Which isn’t a giant deal, though it does show that they didn’t design the tabs very well since I didn’t push hard at all when locking them. What is a big deal, though, is that over the course of a month I emailed them twice and messaged them on Facebook once to see if I could get replacement lids for the two that had tabs break off. They didn’t reply to either email. And to top it off, it shows that they looked at my Facebook message and didn’t reply. I’ll never purchase anything from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon M. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: What is with the lids?
customer_reviews.text: I got these in yesterday. Very well packed, and so far I haven't seen any problems with the glass. The glass seems to be of very nice quality. The lids however, are a big problem. I washed everything up to get them ready to use, and now can't get the lids back on. I will continue to work with these for a bit today to see if I can figure out the trick of putting the units back together, but for right now - low rating.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: These lids do not close
customer_reviews.text: I bought this version and the multi compartment version of these that Prep Naturals offers. The lids do not close- I mean literally when I press the side flaps meant for clamping the lid, they come undone. Do not buy this product or any offered by Prep Naturals. Also the lids are 100% plastic which sort of defeats the purpose of buying glass Tupperware.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: I bought these... not that great
customer_reviews.text: I'm only listing down sides to this product: 1) They are really heavy. 2) The lids are the real problem. They can't be put in the dishwasher. Which I have not done but the lids are warped. Putting them on can be really tough to do. Side snaps don't always line up. You have to put your full body weight on the lid to line up. But the biggest issue is the lid's can go in the dishwasher. Seriously .. that's just wrong. there has to be similar product where the lids are dishwasher safe. I don't recommend this and can't explain why it has a high rating but its amazon... they allow the manufactures to manipulate scoring
customer_reviews.author: Keith Sottung

customer_reviews.title: Not a good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have always used Amazon recommendations as a guide to assist me purchase. This is not a good purchase. They do not nest for storage so you have to stack with insulation between. The glass is VERY FRAGILE, I have had them a couple weeks and I’ve had to toss 2 (two) because they chipped. I have not even used them, they were in the cabinet.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond B.

customer_reviews.title: Nearly Perfect ...
customer_reviews.text: Durable glass containers for heating foods as well as strorage. The only dislike is the gaskets in the lids tend to fall out and do not remain securely attached to the lid... which is annoying. When properly re-seated the container is completely leak-proof. A minor change in design would make them perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective lids
customer_reviews.text: Horribly designed lids- do not fit onto the containers correctly & will not snap in place. When they do manage to finally go on, the process takes a good 5-10 minutes. Every single one of my lids came this way, so I don't think I received just a "flawed" item. The lids are also not dishwasher safe. I wanted a backup for my Pyrex sets, but this is not it. The only positive is that the containers themselves are a nice size, but without working lids, it's not worth the price for just 5 glass containers. I plan on continuing to stick with my Pyrex.
customer_reviews.author: T.R.

customer_reviews.title: Not leakproof when you can't close them.
customer_reviews.text: The size of the containers is perfect for salads, stews, and entree items. The containers themselves are thick and appear to be well made. The problem? Three of the five lids do not close properly. Each of these lids, only three tabs actually close. Kind of a problem if you want something sloppy for lunch. Since I typically take soup and salad, you can see how this is a problem for me. It's hard to juggle the two functional containers between my husband and myself.
customer_reviews.author: TellItLikeItIS

customer_reviews.title: Great for organizing and storage
customer_reviews.text: Much more durable and robust than plastic storage. See more long-term value with these. They're just the right size to store about one meal's worth of food. Seals tightly so food is preserved. Easy to clean - no residue or gunk like you have with plastic containers.
customer_reviews.author: Adam G.

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Glass and Lids are semi okay
customer_reviews.text: Really like this containers, Good quality Glass, Lids can be better quality. Size is great deep enough for prepped lunches. Containers stack up nicely in the fridge. Easy cleaning and seals can be removed proper cleaning. Lids can be better quality fells little light for the container and can have better locking. I love the moister opening on the lid, this helps a lot with hot meals not getting soggy with all the moisture in the container. Overall good quality product with some recommendation to fix lid and locking quality.
customer_reviews.author: Kunal

customer_reviews.title: Just got them
customer_reviews.text: These just arrived so this is just my initial review, if I have issues later I will update. These arrived well packaged, with no damage. After washing and drying, I found in my examination that while pretty easy to unclip the top to open them, I found some difficulty in securing them closed. I have some arthritis in my hands, so closing them, as well as holding the heavy glass to wash them was difficult. Thank goodness they are dishwasher safe. Bottom line: don’t get these if you have serious joint issues with your hands and fingers, otherwise you’re good.
customer_reviews.author: C. Palma

customer_reviews.title: Shattered in my husband’s hands!
customer_reviews.text: I have had these storage containers for some time. I liked them. But they are difficult to shut, as other reviews have mentioned. Tonight I had trouble shutting one filled with leftovers from dinner. I asked my husband to help me close it and the glass literally shattered in his hands! He was cut (glass was everywhere!!!), luckily not requiring stitches, but it’s deep and this was completely shocking. We were so stunned that I didn’t take pictures and I should have. I’m just really surprised that these could be shattered by merely trying to seal the lid. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Carly A.

customer_reviews.title: Latches don't last
customer_reviews.text: I bought a set of these 9 months ago, and at first thought they were great. Then started having trouble with the latches: they simply won't stay snapped shut. First one box failed, then another. So, if you're looking to *rent* food storage boxes, go ahead; you'll get a few months' use out of these. Me, I'm going with a different brand and technology.
customer_reviews.author: Costero

customer_reviews.title: May not be a good choice for folks with arthritis.
customer_reviews.text: We've been using these a lot over the past seven months and we really like them. The only glitch which will impact some people is that these can be hard to close. My girlfriend has arthritis in her hands and simply cannot muster the strength to close these. On the other hand, it is not a problem for me, so it's now simply my job to do the closing. That's OK or us and we will not hesitate to buy more of these. Just be aware for folks who may have strength or pain issues in their hands.
customer_reviews.author: BCTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Rubber Seals Fall Out EVERY time you open and close them
customer_reviews.text: I would look elsewhere!! Glass Lock is a great brand and i wish i had stuck with them. The glass seems sturdy but when i finally opened them to wash them the rubber seal flopped right out. I can imagine this happening every time you open and close the container! This is going to be super annoying and I already threw out the packaging so i will probably have to keep them. Also could be a cleaning issue as stuff will easily get under the seal. Thought i did my homework on these but apparently not well enough.
customer_reviews.author: MelHoo

customer_reviews.title: Lids are Defective
customer_reviews.text: ***update: the company contacted me and sent me a whole new set! That’s great customer service! The new lids are packed with a cellophane liner- allowing the lids to release easy and not become fused to the glass base during shipping. Well done! Added 2 stars! SO disappointed- the lids have a silicone seal/gasket that came out of the lids before I even used them! I tried to put them back in but they do not stay. Am I supposed to glue them? What type of glue should I use? I didn’t know I was buying a project. Buyer BEWARE!
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Found my meal prep soulmate...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for! Ordering more. The size is perfect for my meal prep - lunch and dinner. I’d recommend ordering the bigger ones if you’re a guy and the smaller ones for females. Literally perfect. I hated using those plastic containers and microwaving them day in and day out, just seems toxic. I was so happy to find glass meal prep containers. These are it. They even have a vent on the lids when you microwave so you can leave the lid over it to prevent splatters. They seal tight. I’m in love.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, until one of the lid handles broke
customer_reviews.text: Title says it all. I was snapping the lid on the container, and one of the clips broke. Now it's not sealed tight, so I can't use it as a food saver. Going to see if I can get a lid replacement, but if this happened after 1 week of use, doubtful the other lids will last long. Edit: Down to 1 star. So far, I've had 2 lids break on me, just from snapping the lid on to the container. I also have another lid that wont secure all the way down. I've messaged the company, but no response. I will be looking for a better product.
customer_reviews.author: JEG

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with purchase (8 35oz containers)
customer_reviews.text: I made a video that you can watch for this product. I am very pleased with my purchase the glass feels nice and solid, the lids seal nicely although they can be a little difficult to get on every now and then. The pictures i posted shows how they looked stacked with and without the lids. If you are going to stack them with the lids be aware the lids are slightly convex so there is a little wobble when stacking them, i would go more than 4 high. Other than that, you cant beat this product especially at this price
customer_reviews.author: Woshjimer

customer_reviews.title: Overall good, but they don't nest
customer_reviews.text: These are very durable, dishwasher safe (top rack for the lid) and the vent in the lid is very convenient. The only downside is that they stack, but don't nest in to each other at all, so they just barely fit into a standard cabinet if you put the lids to the side. Also, one of them may be misshapen because the lid is very hard to snap on. All in all I'm happy with the purchase, but the design could have been better.
customer_reviews.author: M. Mott

customer_reviews.title: Worthless lid clasps
customer_reviews.text: Really nice to start. Solid container. But within 2 weeks of use the lid clasps started spontaneously unhooking, causing the lid to fall off in my bag. I'd watch the pop open and it would take luck to get them to shut.
customer_reviews.author: Khald

customer_reviews.title: Lids don't close
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how these got good reviews. The lids are impossible to snap shut. They either won't snap shut at all or keep popping open. Good luck if you buy them. Returned the set.
customer_reviews.author: Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Lids stopped working.  Useless after that.
customer_reviews.text: I originally posted a positive review and actually purchased 2 sets. But the gaskets on the lids got dirty very quickly. Once you remove them to clean them, the lids won't lock anymore. It appears the seals go too far into the lid and leave too much space. I never put the lids in the dishwasher, they were always hand washed. This was an expensive $50 mistake. I don't need glass bowls without lids! The seller has never responded to my messages.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy R.

customer_reviews.title: Best alternative to plastic
customer_reviews.text: I switched to glass containers after using Tupperware all my life. I love that I don’t have to transfer food to another container to heat it. They are even oven safe. I can use them to freeze and don’t even have to label them because they are see through. This us a good size for left overs. I even brought them to a restaurant because I never empty my plate. They are leak proof which is great. They go from my fridge to the microwave. The lids have vents and the containers are stackable. Perfect for meal prepping. Best thing of all, I am getting rid of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: God Is Everywhere

customer_reviews.title: Most versatile dish in the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Just ordered my second set. So convenient to be able to cook and store and eat out of the same container. The deli I go to for lunch tares out the weight so I can get food from the salad bar without using one of theirs (they actually know how much it weighs by now :)). Really a win-win, since they save a container and this is far better quality than anything disposable. Not quite leakproof though, best to wrap it in a plastic bag if you're transporting something in it. But if you press the lid down you can make it leakproof temporarily to mix something together (IE overnight oats).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BEST value for an EXCELLENT product!
customer_reviews.text: We've been meal prepping for a couple of years, and over time have gone through so many different containers in our quest to find the "right" ones. Plastic stains, smells and cracks easily. Glass is great, but the lids have to be high quality. After ordering these, we are happy to report we've found them! First, the 36oz size is perfect for just about any meal. The glass containers are high quality and will "stack" for storage, just not completely one inside the other. The clear glass and lids save time by making everything visible and interchangeable. Lids lock tightly without a struggle (as with some we've tried). All comes clean easily in dishwasher. Will be purchasing another set!
customer_reviews.author: Prufrock

customer_reviews.title: RECEIVED 3 INSTEAD OF 5, A RUSTED METAL TOOTHBRUSH HOLDER AND PRODUCE SAVER BOWL
customer_reviews.text: I just received my package and what was advertised was a 5 pack glass container set, what I received was a 3 pack set, with a RUSTED toothbrush organizer and a random plastic produce saver container. I cant make this up. Im highly upset! I must have checked the empty box about 5 times just to make sure I wasn’t tripping! I have a presentation to present and give away 5 meals today and now Im short 2!
customer_reviews.author: Jay Ari

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Lid can stain though.
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I got these for meal prep. I spent a long time reviewing containers, and these seemed to be the best. So far, they are doing their job very well. We cook large batches of food on weekends, and these containers hold individual serving sizes for both my wife and myself. My only compliant is that the lids can be stained by anything tomato-based. We made chili, and realized that unless you want tomato stained lids, you couldn't let the tomato juice splash onto the lid - so, it goes straight into the fridge, carefully, without tilting or shaking or sloshing.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Lids are worthless
customer_reviews.text: Not real happy with this purchase. The size of the containers are bigger than I thought they would be. They hold a lot of food, which is hard when you are meal prepping in my opinion. But that's my fault not looking more at the sizing. What I'm real upset about is the tops. The rubber lining in the lids are always coming out. You can push them back in but I shouldn't have to do that all the time. Also the lids are VERY hard to snap shut. I don't have any dexterity issues and it was hard for me to push the sides in to close. I may donate these and get a different set or something.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Super high quality. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.text: This is our second set of Prep Naturals glass meal prep containers. These are such high quality! Easy to prep, easy to re-heat, easy to clean, very durable. I love how well these seal; we have not had any issues with leaking. I throw them in the dishwasher and they come out brilliant and we do it all again on Sunday (prep day!). I highly recommend them for anyone who is converting over from plastic meal prep containers (which crack, warp, break, and leave dishwasher residue that soaks into your food - eww). Try these! You will love them.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn H.

customer_reviews.title: I expected a little more
customer_reviews.text: So like anyone else I bought this to store food. Out of the box, the containers are a little heavy, they are glass. Seems fairly airtight. After a few days of use, I noticed the lids are not amazing. After awhile I can see the lids getting worn out and the container may not be as airtight as before. Also be careful with the container bc any type of dings may chip or crack the container. It will store your food and it will last as long your careful with it. It is very easy to clean and great in different temperatures. Hope this helped !
customer_reviews.author: Joon yi

customer_reviews.title: Keeps food fresh longer
customer_reviews.text: I bought these containers back in July and haven’t done much cooking until recently. I put some of my meal prep in these glass containers and the rest into a different brand glass container. Being the diet failure that I am, I “forgot” about my prepped food and found it buried in the back of my fridge 2 weeks later. The Prep Naturals containers kept my food looking and smelling fresh. The other glass container was covered in mold. It looked like two different meals. The difference is definitely in the cover. Anyway, very pleased with this product and now use these containers for all my leftovers.
customer_reviews.author: Meg McCormick

customer_reviews.title: Almost Impossible to Open or Close the Lids
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe how difficult it is to open and close these lids. I love the glass containers but with osteoarthritis, it's a serious challenge to put these to good use and there was no mention at all in the description concerning this issue. Not sure if others have found this to be true as well, but wish at this point that I could return them, however the window for return has closed. Perhaps the company will reach out with a few suggestions, and if they suggest something that will make these containers easier to open and close, I will most definitely update my review at that time.
customer_reviews.author: Patience

customer_reviews.title: Danger!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these almost two years. They were just okay. The lid is REALLY hard to seal. The first two sides snap easily then the third and fourth get really hard to snap. The only way I had found was to kind of squeeze it with the palms of my hands at the same time. Today the thing totally broke in my hand. I’m VERY lucky it did t cut me severely. I did lose some fresh tuna salad however. :-( And of course this one had to be trashed and leery of using the others again. Don’t buy! Rubbermaid makes a better product that isn’t class but the lid seal is flawless.
customer_reviews.author: Mark McCormick

customer_reviews.title: not happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: The glass containers are fine. However, the gasket/seal rings, whatever you want to call them don't stay put on the lids. When I try to put them back, they tear. I'll use the glass containers but they're useless for food storage since they can't be sealed and that was my purpose for buying them.
customer_reviews.author: SandraR

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for prep cooking!
customer_reviews.text: I am transitioning to a WFPB diet. To make it easier, I like to prep cook various beans, rice, quinoa, lentils, etc. These are the perfect size! 8 ounces of dried beans cooked fits in these containers just right. It is wonderful to be able to see what is in each container, and how much is left, without having to take off a lid. They stack nicely if you "burp" the lid. The rectangular shape is space efficient. All in all I am completely satisfied with my purchase. I just hope the lids hold up for a reasonable amount of time!
customer_reviews.author: Lee H

customer_reviews.title: Wife approved
customer_reviews.text: Bought these without consulting my wife (!!!) as a surprise for her, but she immediately loved them. We normally use plastic containers for most of our food items, but for things like tomato sauce which stain plastic these are great. The amount they hold is the size we most commonly use anyways so they are very useful and cleaning them has been pretty easy as well. The glass bottoms are oven safe and the whole thing is microwave safe and dishwasher safe. Time will tell how the plastic lids hold up, but early signs are good!
customer_reviews.author: David Munoz

customer_reviews.title: SO hard to close!!
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love these, but the lids are IMPOSSIBLE to click closed! I sometimes need to bang them pretty hard against the edge of the counter for them to shut. They do a great job once they are closed and I love that they stay sealed, but the effort required to shut them is ridiculous!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plastic top-one side broke
customer_reviews.text: One side if the plastic lid ripped off while I was washing it and getting ready to use. 😔😢 I should have just ordered the other brand I ordered before. Not cool. Lets see if the others last or rip off as well. Amazon this is order #2 that has FAILED. We place a lot of orders and the quality is always amazing, but this .... I cannot believe this! I did not even get a chance to use. Who makes snap boxes that do not properly SNAP?
customer_reviews.author: Mit

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking containers but there are issues with the lids
customer_reviews.text: The glass containers are nice and I have had no issues with that part, but the plastic lids have warped a bit after several washes. Also, even when they were brand new I had some issues with using the plastic clasps to close everything up. My husband thinks the lid has to be specifically lined up on top of the glass to close properly, like to the millimeter. From using previous food storage containers, it shouldn't be that difficult to use the clasps. I have almost hurt myself trying to close the darn clasps. I'll be looking elsewhere for new glass food storage containers.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Romaine

customer_reviews.title: Too hard to close!!!!
customer_reviews.text: They are horrible. So difficult to close!!!!! It takes all my strength to get the tabs shut. Sometimes I can't. Its a shame because otherwise they are perfect. Great size and definitely leak proof. You need to have good upper body strength if you buy.
customer_reviews.author: CarolynJ

customer_reviews.title: My new to-go containers
customer_reviews.text: I carry these in my car, and in my bicycle's pannier bags. These are used as to-go containers instead of using the restaurants styropfoam (so harmful to the planet). These reusable glass containers are great because I can stick leftover directly from the fridge into the oven or microwave. These are smaller than I thought they would be but bringing 2 along everywhere gets the job done. I even use them to take food to work, so 5 is perfect. 2 in vehicle, 2 in bike, 1 to work. The seal also keep everything air tight and fresh, and keeps smells from taking over your vehicle as traditional styrofoam or paper takeout containers do
customer_reviews.author: JdmSkylineGtr

customer_reviews.title: Leak proof BPA-free glass containers perfect for meal prepping and portion control
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get more glass containers for meal prepping my lunches for work but without dividers. These are a perfect size for portion control and it easily fits my protein and vegetables in one container. I like glass because it doesn't stain the container when I microwave it and I like that these are BPA free so I feel safe to heat up food and eat from these. These are also dishwasher safe which makes them easy to clean. The lids for these containers easily snap in place which makes it leak proof so I can store soups and liquids without having to worry about them spilling in my lunch bag.
customer_reviews.author: MerrY RevieWer

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size!
customer_reviews.text: We've been using disposable food prep containers for years and they are so bad for the environment (even if you reuse them a couple of times). I'm so glad we picked these up, they are the perfect size, feel super sturdy and I feel so much better about our environmental impact. I had a thick and hearty soup in one of the containers that didn't spill... I was stoked! I could never do that in one of my old containers. I think we might buy another set so my husband and I can prep for the entire week!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Glossy Glass Containers
customer_reviews.text: This is first of my set of containers as I have been on a mission to say good bye to plastic containers as they are spoiling environment as well as they are not health friendly especially while using them in Microwaves. I repeat, please don't use plastic. The order arrived with in 24 hours and thanks to my Prime account. They are not just beautiful but durable on par with Pyrex branded items. Not just reasonably priced but they come in nice sizes. My wife just loves them and filling the groceries in most of them. Will be planning to order another set of these
customer_reviews.author: Gadget_Lover

customer_reviews.title: wonderful containers as wonderful customer service
customer_reviews.text: I used this container, which is nicely made, to freeze some chocolate covered rice cakes. It was put in the freezer 4 days ago. When I took it out to open the plastic flap on one of the short sides , it broke off - BUT- Prep Naturals contacted me and sent me an entirely new set which I have been using and enjoying since. Their customer service is excellent and the containers really are well made, durable and have many uses. I have since even ordered more of these durable, well made easy to use glass containers and would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: kodasha

customer_reviews.title: Unnecessary vent and difficult to close
customer_reviews.text: I had loaned my snapware glass containers to a family member to take Thanksgiving left-overs home and decided to get some more containers since I don't know when I 'll get my others back. Snapware doesn't just come in the individual sizes and I didn't need any but the 2-cup rectangular size. These are an acceptable alternative, but not for taking anything to work in a backpack because the seal on the vent is easily dislodged and it also requires almost herculean strength to snap the 4 side closures down. Snapware is better.
customer_reviews.author: Quita E.

customer_reviews.title: Seem to be good quality
customer_reviews.text: I would definitely suggest actually seeing the size of this product in person before you buy. Based off of the pictures (and the food in the containers) I thought I was buying a larger size. They are, in fact, exactly the size as stated, just look to be bigger in pictures. They all came in tact, but a complaint of mine was SO much unnecessary packaging (plastic/cardboard on each one and under each lid) that made it kind of annoying to unpack and also is just wasteful. If you know what you're getting into size wise and are ok with waste, I would recommend these. they seem to be of good quality so far.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Muniak

customer_reviews.title: We enjoy using these....
customer_reviews.text: I don't think we are hard on them. We don't microwave in them. We portion out food for the freezer in them, thaw them out and then wash and repeat for the most part. Store some food in the refrigerator. Send home leftovers with guests. We have a number of brands of glass food storage, these work better than some because they are easier to close. We have not run into any problem with them as yet. Haven't dropped any. [knock on wood lol] We put the glass in the dishwasher but we wash all the tops by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Beth

customer_reviews.title: You have to buy these
customer_reviews.text: These are my new favorite meal prep containers. I moved from only using plastic and bought these. They are sturdy and hold a good amount of food. The orings come out of the lid in both the vent and the outer edge to be cleaned and go back together fairly easily. I have been using them for weeks and haven't had any issues. I do really wish they stacked together better with the lids on as they like to slid. I've already convinced several other people to buy a set as well.
customer_reviews.author: K. Webb

customer_reviews.title: Great value and very durable
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using these containers for more than two years, and using at least one of them every day to bring food to work for lunch. They’re fantastically durable (some have been in the freezer for 6 months+, others microwaved every day), and none have discolored or been damaged at all. The only downside is that the rubber gasket sometimes gets a little gunked up and it’s difficult to remove it from the lid without damaging it, so you just have to be careful when you’re taking them out to clean them (because you will need to clean them)
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: A major issue with mine
customer_reviews.text: The seal/gasket sticks to the glass and teared when you removed on a few of the set. It basically rendered 2 of the pack useless as they tore when attempting to remove them. Another leaks a bit, as it was compromised with removal. The other two, work beautifully, clean up easily enough, and don't seem to hold stains (even tomato sauce). This wasn't the case with the other set I purchased recently as well. Maybe you can send me some new seals to replace the torn ones?
customer_reviews.author: Jdl8r

customer_reviews.title: Not the most sturdy or best built, but for the price they are great
customer_reviews.text: The tops on these are reasonably secure and leak proof. The thing is, they are cheap plastic and don't clip perfectly. What this means is that if there is a big temperature swing, e.g. caused by the refrigerator, then the hooks will unclamps themselves. But once out of the fridge, even though they don't feel solid, I have never had the top come off and I use these all the time to bring lunch to work (been doing this about a year). So even though I feel like it might happen, I will give 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: EAS

customer_reviews.title: Great containers!
customer_reviews.text: Love these containers, perfect for prepping for meals for the week. I prefer to chop/prep my ingredients for different recipes. Definitely freezer safe (I froze a few of my bananas for smoothies in them) Super durable, dishwasher safe on the top rack. The only time they would ever be difficult to close is if the band on the kid isn’t properly in place. Otherwise it’s super easy to close and open. (Which is also great because the bands are also easy to remove and clean) my only complaint is that the pack should come in a set of six instead of five.
customer_reviews.author: daphne1213

customer_reviews.title: Breaks very easily.
customer_reviews.text: broke in 2 months, seller claims not in warranty and will not replace. Might consider buying the real deal next time. Not worth the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: WendyM

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased these twice and use them all the time. I've purchased another brand and had the lids break- these have worked really well for me. I've put the lids in the dishwasher and had no issues. My only issue has been that with the second batch I ordered, the lids are really tight and I have to work to get them to close; this wasn't the case the first time so I'm not sure what happened. Not a big deal though. I've also used these in the freezer and they worked well. Very happy overall!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: breaks way too easily
customer_reviews.text: within two days of getting them one of them cracked while sitting in the cabinet and the other was broken in the top rack of the dishwasher where another brand was also stacked and they came out fine. wouldn't buy these again
customer_reviews.author: B. J. L. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Great high quality reusable containers
customer_reviews.text: These are great for environmentally responsible meal prep. It holds enough for a single meal, feels sturdy and with four snaps, it feels solidly leak proof. My only gripe is that when empty the containers don't nicely stack into each other. It doesn't matter much for us but if space is at a premium and you don't plan on using these all the time, it might be an issue for you. These things are easy to clean and the best part is that it's not plastic and reusable.
customer_reviews.author: BayAreaJay

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended- better than name brand!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality- you won’t be disappointed!!! The lids fit perfectly on the sturdy glass and create a no-leak seal! I made some meal prep egg bakes for the oven and cooked the first two and have the others in the fridge. They cooked perfectly in the oven! Then I re-heated them in the microwave and have now washed them in the dishwasher and no lid shrinking (I can’t say that about the name brand lids I had before). Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: robert waner

customer_reviews.title: Great for taking lunch to work
customer_reviews.text: I got a contract position and being hourly it became expensive to go out to lunch. I decided to start bringing my lunch in to work. I am tired of Tupperware as it is expensive and it also stains after storing tomato sauce like lasagna in it. I also noticed after years of use the Tupperware lids quit fitting well also. I decided to give these a try. I was very impressed. These microwave really well, the sauce and heat has no effect on the Pyrex glass so these are perfect. The lids are also leak free so these are amazing. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory D. Guth

customer_reviews.title: Nice but not durable
customer_reviews.text: I liked these a lot at first. The lids are tight, they're dishwasher safe, and the portion size is large. They do not stack well but that didn't bother me too much. Unfortunately, despite what seems to be thick, heavy glass, they're not durable at all. Today, my fairly well padded, insulated lunch box fell 28" (I measured) off my desk onto a carpeted floor. Immediately I heard a crash and sure enough I now have an insulated lunchbox full of broken glass. I guess I'll be going back to plastic containers.
customer_reviews.author: Miles Brown Jr

customer_reviews.title: Update
customer_reviews.text: They seem to be the perfect size for leftovers. Very happy so far with the quality. Will be ordering more. Update. It seems that the tops keep opening. So I guess I will not be buying these again. UPDATE: The company contacted me and reimbursed me, which I thought was very professional of them. They claimed that they are a small company and want their customers to be happy. Customer service goes a long way and is lacking today so I applaud them and would consider ordering from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen F.

customer_reviews.title: Holes in lid
customer_reviews.text: They have these little holes in the lid with a door over it. I guess this is so you can microwave them without taking the lid off. Anyway, that little "feature" compromises the watertightness of the lid. They will leak. I know because whenever I get new storage containers I fill them with water, snap the lids on, and shake. These didn't pass.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Quality containers! Tough to close though
customer_reviews.text: Love these! Feels durable and safe, have cleaned very well so far. Only complaint is the lids are really tough to secure! I have to use quite a bit of force and really put my back into it, though I'm sure that translates to more leak proof as I haven't had issues. Would probably give some people, or kids, trouble to use. Saw some questions about stacking, they don't nest or don't lock together strongly when stacked but it's sturdy enough to stack in my fridge or cabinets nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: Britt

customer_reviews.title: Made for crap. Save your money.
customer_reviews.text: One of the rubber lid seals broke the very first time I used it. I prepped a meal in the container, put it into my refrigerator and a few days later I took the container out of my refrigerator, unlocked the lid and pulled it off the glass container portion. The seal ripped as I took the lid off. According the the Q&A section, I can’t get replacement rubber seals.
customer_reviews.author: LS

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected, but seem to be of good quality
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than expected, but that is probably on me. Still suitable for my needs, I think. They are also difficult to close and aren't really made to stack, so be careful if you're meal prepping and want to stack them on top of one another to put in the fridge! They slide on top of one another, and I can forsee them toppling over into the floor! The glass is thick, though, and the lids seem to latch on tight when you put them on. Cannot speak to their "leakproof" claim yet, but it does look promising!
customer_reviews.author: Rani B.

customer_reviews.title: Great portion size, lids VERY difficult to get on
customer_reviews.text: Had for about 6 months, lids still hard to get on, today I shattered one of the containers trying to get the lid on, my wife usually can't get them on without help. After 6 months, you'd think the lids would've broken in by now, just enough to get them on. All I did to get one to shatter was press hard on the lid, no impact was done. Too bad, the portion size is really spot on, and nice having that little vent on the top too.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch Hellum

customer_reviews.title: After 4 months the seals are not sealing
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty good overall but the lids and seals over time have become problematic; you really have to make sure the seal is seated properly and even then, if you have watery liquid, it may still seep through. Case in point today: took some tuna salad to work in my back pack.... a little bit of liquid accumulated and leaked; now my office smells like tuna fish. Fantastic. Lesson Learned. If I have more solid items like rice and chicken/veggies I have not had a problem. They are sturdy, so I still give them 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mich K

product_meta.title: Prep Naturals Glass Meal Prep Containers - Food Prep Containers with Lids Meal Prep - Food Storage Containers Airtight - Lunch Containers Portion Control Containers Bpa-Free (5 Pack,30 Ounce)
feature_bullets: ✅ MEAL PREP CONTAINERS 1 Compartment with SmartestLock locking lids guarantee leakproof food storage without spills.

✅ PREP MEALS AT HOME, THEN EAT ON THE GO – make a lunch box with home-cooked food for the whole family and bring it to work, school or gym. You can cook your food right in the containers then save and reheat the leftovers.

✅ 5 x 30oz GLASS FOOD STORAGE CONTAINERS - Biggest Set and Best Value you can find on Amazon. Perfect for meal prepping and precise portion control. Stay healthy and save time by cooking and freezing your meals for later. DIMENSIONS: 6.5” x 4.75” x 2”

✅ HEALTHIER ALTERNATIVE TO PLASTIC - Our Containers Are Made From Borosilicate Glass, Which Makes Them Much Stronger Than Other Cheaper Containers. Borosilicate is The Strongest Glass Available, Oven Safe and Won’t Break as Easily as Cheaper Alternatives Offered by Other Sellers on Amazon.

CUSTOMER SERVICE - Please, if you have any questions or issues regarding the Prep Naturals glass containers set please do not hesitate to send the seller a message through Amazon we will respond within 24 hours.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars7,119 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
